channel.title: IMPmouse applet needed and intresting find
channel.description:
the issue revolves around a webbrowser not creating a seperate java runtime for each applet. The work around is a impApplet that takes in all orders and disperses it to each seperate game applet. This issue came up when we tested multiple clients. writing it now.
The good news is anyone can create a java applet that controls the runescape one. This is easier than modifying their class loader.
I need to know what the applet should have in-terms of debug features and logging info.
Trackback: http://www.impsoft.net/viewtopic.php?p=836#836

@moparisthebest wrote:

why do you need a seperate java runtime for each applet? are you sending commands straight to the individual jvmâ€™s or somthing?
